CONJUGATES: sunburns (v. pres. 3rd sing.) | sunburning (v. pres. part.) | sunburned (or sunburnt) (v. past | v. past part. | adj.)
ETYMOLOGY: Compound of the noun 'sun' and the verb 'burn', recorded since the late 16th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Inflammation, reddening, or blistering of the skin caused by overexposure to ultraviolet radiation from the sun.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 晒伤；皮肤因过度暴露于阳光下的紫外线辐射而引起的炎症、发红或水泡。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Despite wearing a hat, he suffered a severe sunburn on his neck.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 尽管戴着帽子，他的脖子还是严重晒伤了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cause or sustain damage to the skin by overexposure to the sun.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 晒伤（动词）；使皮肤因过度暴露于阳光下而受损。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Be careful, you will sunburn if you stay out during the hottest part of the day.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 小心，如果在一天中最热的时候待在外面，你会晒伤的。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective (describing the state of a noun, derived from the past participle)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having skin that is affected by sunburn, usually red, painful, or peeling. ('Sunburnt' is more common in British English.)
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 晒伤的；被太阳晒红或晒黑的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her nose was bright red and visibly sunburnt after the trip.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 旅行结束后，她的鼻子鲜红，明显晒伤了。
